          My gameStart method is responsible for checking to see what word is currently "positive" in the gameReady method it will cycle through loops to see what word is valid and will then go on to print it.

 void paint(java.awt.Graphics pane)
          Here I will paint of so many wonderful wonder graphics, some of which will be dependent on variables This means that the menu wont print unless I have set a value or boolean menu to true or 1 It will also have a loop for both sets of ducks to see if they're visible, and then print those that are.

Method Detail

addingducks

public void addingducks()
the addingducks method generates 500 random ducks with random x and y coordinates and adds them to an array

gameReady

public void gameReady()
The game ready method is responsible for pausing the program while changing the variables that will result in different of the "Ready, Set, Go!" as well as the menu Opening that I have for my game.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics pane)
Here I will paint of so many wonderful wonder graphics, some of which will be dependent on variables This means that the menu wont print unless I have set a value or boolean menu to true or 1 It will also have a loop for both sets of ducks to see if they're visible, and then print those that are.

paint in class java.awt.Window

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
I used my myPressed method for more sensitive clicking items such as the ducks. It starts by grabbing the x and y coordinates and then continues to put them through a series of loops to see if they clicked on a currently visible duck or menu in which it then performs a series of statements or calls on another method to do so.

Specified by:
mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent arg0)
Specified by:
mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

timegraph

public void timegraph(java.awt.Graphics pane)
The timegraph method is used to portray the time left of the game to the player It does this by taking the counter and subtracting one each time the loop is completed
